qas.question: Where do Armenians mostly live besides Armenia?
How many Armenians live outside Armenia and the republic within it?
Where do most emigrant Armenians live?

answers.text: Russia, the United States, France, Georgia, Iran, Ukraine, Lebanon, and Syria

qas.question: Why did many Armenians leave Armenia?
Where to Russians live besides Armenia?
How many people of Ukranian ancestry live in Russia?
Why did many Armenians leave Iran?

plausible_answers.text: Russia, the United States, France, Georgia, Iran, Ukraine, Lebanon, and Syria

qas.question: Where have people from the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic immigrated to?
Of what ancestry are people who have emigrated outside of the US?

context: Armenians constitute the main population of Armenia and the de facto independent <a0_0><b4_0>Nagorno-Karabakh Republic<b4_0/><a0_0/>. There is a wide-ranging diaspora of <a1_0><b5_0>around 5 million<b5_0/><a1_0/> people of full or partial <b8_0>Armenian<b8_0/> ancestry living outside of modern Armenia. The largest Armenian populations today exist in <a2_0><b7_0>Russia, the United States, France, Georgia, Iran, Ukraine, Lebanon, and Syria<b7_0/><a2_0/>. With the exceptions of Iran and the former Soviet states, the present-day Armenian diaspora was formed mainly as a result of <a3_0><b6_0>the Armenian Genocide<b6_0/><a3_0/>.
